sen.j: 御船 千鶴子（みふね ちづこ、 1886年7月17日 - 1911年1月19日、24歳没）は、透視 (超心理学)能力を持つ超能力者として福来友吉博士に紹介された女性。
sen.e: Chizuko MIFUNE (July 17, 1886 - January 19, 1911, died at the age of 24) was a woman introduced as a woman of supernatural power having toshi (clairvoyance or second sight power) (parapsychology) by Dr. Tomokichi FUKURAI.

Chizuko MIFUNE (July 17, 1886 - January 19, 1911, died at the age of 24) was a woman introduced as a woman of supernatural power having toshi (clairvoyance or second sight power) (parapsychology) by Dr. Tomokichi FUKURAI.

Chizuko MIFUNE (July 17, 1886 - January 19, 1911, died at the age of 24) was a woman introduced as a woman of supernatural power having toshi (clairvoyance or second sight power) (parapsychology) by Dr. Tomokichi FUKURAI.

sen.j: 熊本県宇土郡松合村（現宇城市）出身。
sen.e: She was from Matsuai-mura (now Uki City), Udo-gun, Kumamoto Prefecture.
She was from Matsuai-mura (present Uki City), Udo-gun, Kumamoto Prefecture.
She was from Matsuai-mura (present Uki City), Udo-gun, Kumamoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 漢方医・御船秀益と、その妻ユキの二女。
sen.e: She was the second daughter of a Chinese medicine doctor, Hidemasu MINUNE and his wife, Yuki.
She was the second daughter of a Chinese medicine doctor, Hidemasu MINUNE and his wife, Yuki.
She was the second daughter of a Chinese medicine doctor, Hidemasu MINUNE and his wife, Yuki.

sen.j: 生まれつき進行性の難聴があり、成人するころには左耳が聴こえ辛かったという。
sen.e: She was born with progressive hypacusia and about when she reached adulthood she was said to have had difficulty in hearing in her left ear.
She was born with progressive impaired hearing. and about when she reached adulthood, she was said to have had difficulty in hearing in her left ear.
sen.cmt: カンマを補いました。 hypacusia→impaired hearing と修正しました。
sen.e: She was born with progressive impaired hearing and when she reached adulthood, she was said to have had difficulty in hearing in her left ear.
sen.cmt: ピリオドを修正しました。

sen.j: 繊細な感受性と豊かな情緒性を持っていたと言われる。
sen.e: She was said to have had fine sensibility and prolific emotions.
She was said to have had fine sensibility and rich emotions.
She was said to have had fine sensibility and rich emotions.

sen.j: また、観音菩薩を篤く信仰していたが、悲観的な感情にとらわれる面もあったという。
sen.e: She also earnestly believed in Kannon Bosatsu (Kannon Buddhisattva), however, she was easily caught in pessimistic feelings.
She also earnestly believed in Kannon Bosatsu (Kannon Buddhisattva), however, she was easily caught in pessimistic feelings.
She also earnestly believed in Kannon Bosatsu (Kannon Buddhisattva), however, she was easily caught in pessimistic feelings.

sen.j: 22歳のとき、陸軍中佐河地可謙と結婚。
sen.e: At the age of 22 she married Kaken KAWACHI, Lieutenant Colonel.
At the age of 22, she married Kaken KAWACHI, a Lieutenant Colonel.
sen.cmt: カンマ、 a を補いました。
sen.e: At the age of 22, she married Kaken KAWACHI, a Lieutenant Colonel.

sen.j: ある日、夫の財布からなくなった50円が義親配偶者の親の使っていた仏壇の引き出しにあると言い当てたことで、姑は疑いをかけられたことを苦にして自殺未遂を起こしてしまう。
sen.e: One day she guessed right that the fifty yen disappeared from her husband's wallet was in the Buddhist alter that her parents-in-law were using, which caused her mother-in-law to attempt suicide.
One day, she guessed right that the 50 yen disappeared from her husband's wallet was in the Buddhist alter that her parents-in-law were using, which caused her mother-in-law to attempt suicide.
sen.cmt: カンマを補いました。fifty→50 と修正しました。
sen.e: One day, she guessed right that the 50 yen disappeared from her husband's wallet was in the Buddhist alter that her parents-in-law were using, which caused her mother-in-law to attempt suicide.

sen.j: このことで結婚からほどなく離婚することになり実家に戻る。
sen.e: This incident led her to get divorced after a short term marriage and to return to her family home.
This incident led her to divorce him after a short term marriage, and to return to her family home.
sen.cmt: get divorced→divorce him と修正しました。カンマを補いました。
sen.e: This incident led her to divorce him after a short term marriage, and to return to her family home.

sen.j: 実家では義兄（姉の夫）、中学校の舎監・体操教員であった清原猛雄に「お前は透視ができる人間だ」との催眠術をかけられたところ、優れた結果が出たため修練を続けることとなった。
sen.e: Her brother-in-law (her elder sister's husband) in the family house, Takeo KIYOHARA, a shakan (dormitory dean) and PE teacher, mesmerized her, saying "You have the power of toshi (seeing through things or second sight). ", and tested her, which brought forth such good results that he continued her training.

In the family house, her brother-in-law (her older sister's husband) Takeo KIYOHARA, a shakan (dormitory dean) and PE teacher, mesmerized her, saying: "You have the power of toshi [clairvoyance]," and tested her, which brought forth such good results that he continued her training.
sen.cmt: はみ出ていた訳文を入れました。オーダーを修正しました。elder→older,クォーツ内、カッコ内、カンマを修正しました。パンクチュエーションを修正しました。
sen.e: In the family house, her brother-in-law (her older sister's husband) Takeo KIYOHARA, a shakan (dormitory dean) and PE teacher, mesmerized her, saying: "You have the power of toshi [clairvoyance]," and tested her, which brought forth such good results that he continued her training.

sen.j: その後、日露戦争時に第六師団が、撃沈された軍艦・常陸丸事件にたまたま乗っていなかった事を透視したり、三井合名会社の依頼で福岡県大牟田市にて透視を行い、万田炭鉱を発見して謝礼2万円（現在の価値で約2000万円）を得るなどした。
sen.e: Since then with her second sight she guessed right that the Sixth Division Unit happened to have not been on board the annihilated warship, "Hitachi Mar" (Hitachi Maru Incident), or discovered Manda Coal Mine in Omuta City, Fukuoka Prefecture on the request of Mitsui Gomei Kaisha, receiving two 20,000 yen (about 20 million yen in the present value).

After that, she saw through that the Sixth Division Unit happened to have not been on board of the sunk warship, Hitachi Maru at the Russo-Japanese War time, and discovered Manda Coal Mine in Omuta City, Fukuoka Prefecture on the request of Mitsui Gomei Kaisha, receiving 20,000 yen (about 20 million yen in the present value) as rewards.
sen.cmt: カンマを補いました。Since then→After that,annihilated→sunk, "Hitachi Mar" (Hitachi Maru Incident)→Hitachi Maru,two 20.000→20,000 と修正しました。細部を適宜文脈に応じて修正しました。「日露戦争時に」、「謝礼」を補いました。
sen.e: After that, she saw through that the Sixth Division Unit happened to have not been on board of the sunk warship, Hitachi Maru at the Russo-Japanese War time, and discovered Manda Coal Mine in Omuta City, Fukuoka Prefecture on the request of Mitsui Gomei Kaisha, receiving 20,000 yen (about 20 million yen in the present value) as rewards.

sen.j: また、樹皮の下にいる虫の存在や海で紛失した指輪の場所を言い当てたりしたという。
sen.e: She is also said to have guessed right the presence of a bug/bugs under a bark or the place of a ring lost in the sea.
She is also said to have guessed right the presence of a bug or bugs under a bark, and the place of a ring lost in the sea.
sen.cmt: bug/bugs→bug or bugs,or→and と修正しました。カンマを補いました。
sen.e: She is also said to have guessed right the presence of a bug or bugs under a bark, and the place of a ring lost in the sea.

sen.j: 中でも清原は千鶴子に人の人体を透視して病気を診断させたり、手かざしによる治療を試みた。
sen.e: Above all KIYOHARA let Chizuko see through human bodies to diagnose a disorder or treat patients by tekazashi (waving one's hands over patients).
Above all, Kiyohara let Chizuko see through human bodies to diagnose a disorder, or tried to treat patients by tekazashi (waving one's hands over patients).
sen.cmt: KIYOHARA→Kiyohara と修正しました。カンマ、tried to を補いました。
sen.e: Above all, Kiyohara let Chizuko see through human bodies to diagnose a disorder, or tried to treat patients by tekazashi (waving one's hands over patients).

sen.j: 千鶴子の評判が広がり、熊本県立済々黌高等学校（当時は中学）の井芹経平校長が紹介し、1909年から翌1910年にかけ、京都帝国大学（現：京都大学）医学科大学の今村新吉教授（医学）や東京帝国大学（現：東京大学）文化大学の福来友吉助教授（心理学）などの当時の学者が研究を始めた。
sen.e: As Chizuko's reputation extended, she was introduced by Tsunehisa ISERI, the principal of Kumamoto Prefectural Seisei Senior High School (at that time junior high school) and began to be studied by Shinkichi IMAMURA, Tomokichi FUKURAI, professor (psychology) of Cultural School of Tokyo Imperial University (now Tokyo University) of the time and others.

As Chizuko's reputation extended, she was introduced by Tsunehira ISERI, the principal of Kumamoto Prefectural Seisei Senior High School (at that time junior high school), and began to be studied by the scholars of the time including Shinkichi IMAMURA of the College of Medicine of Kyoto Imperial University (present Kyoto University), Tomokichi FUKURAI, professor (psychology) of Cultural School of Tokyo Imperial University (present Tokyo University) from 1909 to the following 1910.
sen.cmt: Tsunehisa→Tsunehira,now→present と修正しました。カンマを補いました。「1909年から翌1910年にかけ」を補いました。「学者が」を補い、修正しました。「京都帝国大学（現：京都大学）医学科大学の」を補いました。なお、「医学科大学」については "College of Medicine"としております。
sen.e: As Chizuko's reputation extended, she was introduced by Tsunehira ISERI, the principal of Kumamoto Prefectural Seisei Senior High School (at that time junior high school), and began to be studied by the scholars of the time including Shinkichi IMAMURA of the College of Medicine of Kyoto Imperial University (present Kyoto University), Tomokichi FUKURAI, professor (psychology) of Cultural School of Tokyo Imperial University (present Tokyo University) from 1909 to the following 1910.

sen.j: 1910年4月10日、熊本の清原の自宅で福来と今村は清原の立会いのもと透視実験を行う。
sen.e: On April 10, 1910 FUKURAI and IMAMURA conducted an experiment on her clairvoyance power in KIYOHARA's charge in his residence.
On April 10, 1910, Fukurai and Imamura conducted an experiment on her clairvoyance power, with Kiyohara's attend in his residence.
sen.cmt: カンマを補いました。FUKURAI→Fukurai,IMAMURA→Imamura,KIYOHARA→Kiyohara,in charge→with attend と修正しました。
sen.e: On April 10, 1910, Fukurai and Imamura conducted an experiment on her clairvoyance power, with Kiyohara's attend in his residence.

sen.j: 人々に背を向け、対象物を手に持って行う千鶴子の透視が不審を招くことに配慮した福来は背を向けても対象物を手に取らないで透視するようにさせたが、この方法では不的中に終わった。
sen.e: FUKURAI, fearing that her method of seeing through things, holding the object and with her back to people might cause doubts, forced her to see through them with her back to them but not holding them, in which method she guessed wrong.

Fukurai, fearing that her method of seeing through things, holding the object and with her back to people might cause doubts, forced her to see through them with her back to them but not holding them, in which method she guessed wrong.

Fukurai, fearing that her method of seeing through things, holding the object and with her back to people might cause doubts, forced her to see through them with her back to them but not holding them, in which method she guessed wrong.

sen.j: 今度は清原が用意した名刺を茶壺に入れ、それに触れることをゆるして透視させると、名刺の文字を言い当てたという。
sen.e: This time they put a business card that KIYOHAARA prepared into a tea jar and told her to see through the jar, allowing her to touch it, and the result was that she guessed right the characters of the card.

Then, they put a business card that Kiyohara prepared into a tea jar, and told her to see through the jar, allowing her to touch it, and the result was that she guessed right the characters of the card.
sen.cmt: カンマを補いました。This time→Then,KIYOHARA→Kiyohara と修正しました。
sen.e: Then, they put a business card that Kiyohara prepared into a tea jar, and told her to see through the jar, allowing her to touch it, and the result was that she guessed right the characters of the card.

sen.j: 千鶴子の透視能力を確信した福来は、この実験結果を心理学会で発表した。
sen.e: FUKURAI, having believed in her clairvoyant power, presented the result of the experiment in an academic meeting of psychology.
Fukurai, having believed in her clairvoyant power, presented the result of the experiment in an academic meeting of psychology.
Fukurai, having believed in her clairvoyant power, presented the result of the experiment in an academic meeting of psychology.

sen.j: これにより、「透視」という言葉が新聞で大きく取り上げられ、真贋論争を含め大きな話題となった。
sen.e: As a result, the word "toshi", going into headlines, became a big newspaper topic including arguments as to its authenticity.
As a result, the word 'toshi' (clairvoyance) picked up on the news papers greatly, became a big topic including the arguments as to its authenticity.
sen.cmt: クォーツを修正しました。(clairvoyance)を補いました。文脈に応じて修正しました。
sen.e: As a result, the word 'toshi' (clairvoyance) picked up on the news papers greatly, became a big topic including the arguments as to its authenticity.

sen.j: 千鶴子のもとには、透視の依頼が殺到したほか、長尾郁子を初めとした「千里眼」の持ち主だと名乗る者たちが続々と現れた。
sen.e: In Chizuko's presence many people including Ikuko NAGAO, who named themselves clairvoyants appeared one after another.
Many of them who claiming themselves as 'Senrigan' (clairvoyant) came to Chizuko including Ikuko NAGAO, as well as the rush of those requests of clairvoyance.
sen.cmt: 文脈に応じて修正しました。
sen.e: Many of them who claiming themselves as 'Senrigan' (clairvoyant) came to Chizuko including Ikuko NAGAO, as well as the rush of those requests of clairvoyance.

sen.j: 1910年9月15日、物理学の権威で東京帝国大学の元総長の山川健次郎が立会い透視実験を行った。
sen.e: On September 15, 1910, in the presence of Kenjiro YAMAKAWA, the former president of Tokyo Imperial University and an authority of physics, a toshi experiment was conducted.
On September 15, 1910, with the attend of Kenjiro YAMAKAWA, the former president of Tokyo Imperial University and an authority of physics, a toshi experiment was conducted.
sen.cmt: in the presence→with the attend と修正しました。
sen.e: On September 15, 1910, with the attend of Kenjiro YAMAKAWA, the former president of Tokyo Imperial University and an authority of physics, a toshi experiment was conducted.

sen.j: 千鶴子は鉛管の中の文字の透視を「成功」させたものの、それは山川の用意したものではなく、福来が練習用に千鶴子に与えたたものであったことが発覚。
sen.e: Chizuko succeeded in guessing the characters in a lead pipe; however, it was revealed that they were not what YAMAKAWA prepared, but what FUKURAI gave her for practice
Chizuko succeeded in guessing the characters in a lead pipe; however, it was revealed that they were not what Yamakawa prepared, but what Fukurai gave her for practice.
sen.cmt: YAMAKAWA→Yamakawa,FUKURAI→Fukurai と修正しました。ピリオドを補いました。
sen.e: Chizuko succeeded in guessing the characters in a lead pipe; however, it was revealed that they were not what Yamakawa prepared, but what Fukurai gave her for practice.

sen.j: この不審な経緯に、新聞は千鶴子の透視能力について否定的な論調を強めて行った。
sen.e: These suspicious details brought forth a strengthened negative tone of the press to her clairvoyant power
These suspicious details brought forth a strengthened negative tone of the press to her clairvoyant power.
sen.cmt: ピリオドを補いました。
sen.e: These suspicious details brought forth a strengthened negative tone of the press to her clairvoyant power.

sen.j: そんな中、千鶴子は長尾郁子の念写を非難する記事を見て、失望と怒りを感じ、清原に「どこまで研究しても駄目です」と言い放ったという。
sen.e: In such a situation Chizuko, having read an article blaming Ikuko NAGAO's psychography, felt disappointed and angry, told KIYOHARA harshly that it would be no use studying me any longer.
In such a situation, Chizuko, having read an article blaming Ikuko NAGAO's psychography, felt disappointed and angry, told KIYOHARA harshly that "it would be no use studying me any longer."
sen.cmt: カンマを補いました。 KIYOHARA→Kiyohara と修正しました。クォーツを補いました。
sen.e: In such a situation, Chizuko, having read an article blaming Ikuko NAGAO's psychography, felt disappointed and angry, told KIYOHARA harshly that "it would be no use studying me any longer."

sen.j: 翌1911年1月18日、二クロム酸カリウムで服毒自殺を図り、翌日未明に24歳の若さで死亡した。
sen.e: On January 18, 1911, next year she attempted suicide by taking potassium dichromate and died before dawn of the next day.
On January 18, 1911, the following year, she committed suicide by taking potassium dichromate, and died at dawn of the following day at the age of merely 24.
sen.cmt: next year→the following year,attempted→committed,before dawn of the next→at dawn of the following と修正しました。カンマを補いました。「24歳の若さで」を補いました。
sen.e: On January 18, 1911, the following year, she committed suicide by taking potassium dichromate, and died at dawn of the following day at the age of merely 24.

sen.j: 地元では自殺の原因は父親との金銭的なトラブルによるものだと見られていた。
sen.e: The locals took it that her suicide was due to money trouble with her father.
The locals took it that her suicide was due to a financial trouble with her father.
sen.cmt: a を補いました。money→financial と修正しました。
sen.e: The locals took it that her suicide was due to a financial trouble with her father.

sen.j: 新聞や世間からの激しい攻撃に耐えられず自殺した、と一般にいわれるが、この時点では彼女を非難する内容の報道はされていない。
sen.e: It is generally said that she killed herself because she could not bear severe attacks from the press and the public:, However, at this point no news blaming her had not been reported.
It is generally said that she killed herself because she could not bear severe attacks from the press and the public; however, no news blaming her had been reported at that point.
sen.cmt: パンクチュエーションを修正しました。had not been→had been,at this point→at that point とし、移動しました。
sen.e: It is generally said that she killed herself because she could not bear severe attacks from the press and the public; however, no news blaming her had been reported at that point.

sen.j: 彼女の「能力」の実在は極めて疑わしい。
sen.e: It is quite doubtful that she had that "power".
It is doubtful that she had that 'ability.'
sen.cmt: quite doubtful→doubtful,power→ability,クォーツを修正しました。
sen.e: It is doubtful that she had that 'ability.'

sen.j: 「透視」に成功した場合でも、意識が集中できないとして彼女は常に観察者に対して背を向けて「透視」しており、側面や正面からの観察は頑なに拒否していた。
sen.e: Even in successful cases she always put her back to observers when conducting "toshi", saying that she could not concentrate, and refused stubbornly observations from the side and the front.

Even in successful cases of 'toshi,' she always put her back to observers when performing 'toshi,' saying that she could not concentrate, and refused stubbornly observations from the side and the front.
sen.cmt: 「透視」を補いました。クォーツを修正しました。conducting→performing と修正しました。
sen.e: Even in successful cases of 'toshi,' she always put her back to observers when performing 'toshi,' saying that she could not concentrate, and refused stubbornly observations from the side and the front.

sen.j: そして成功した場合は常に糊付けで封印された容器が多く、それも10分近く時間をかけている。
sen.e: Most of successful cases included containers sealed with paste, and what was more, it took her nearly ten minutes.
Most of the successful cases were always with the containers sealed with paste, and what was more, it took her nearly 10 minutes.
sen.cmt: the を補いました。「常に」を補いました。included→were with,ten→10 と修正しました。
sen.e: Most of the successful cases were always with the containers sealed with paste, and what was more, it took her nearly 10 minutes.

sen.j: これだけの時間をかければ、つばをつけて封をはがし、また貼り付けて体温で乾かすことが可能という実際の検証結果も示されている。
sen.e: Results of actual verification revealed that this length of time was enough for her to unseal them using saliva, paste them again and dry them with her body temperature.
Results of actual verification revealed that this length of time was enough for her to unseal them using saliva, paste them again and dry them with her body temperature.
Results of actual verification revealed that this length of time was enough for her to unseal them using saliva, paste them again and dry them with her body temperature.

sen.j: 福来博士も、観察者に背を向けていることが疑いを招くと考えて、再三千鶴子を説得していたが、千鶴子は応じていない。
sen.e: Dr. FUKURAI, thinking that the posture of her back to observers might cause suspicion, also persuaded Chizuko again and again, but she would not agree.
Dr. Fukurai, thinking that the posture of her back to observers might cause suspicion, also persuaded Chizuko again and again, but she did not respond it.
sen.cmt: FUKURAI→Fukurai,would not agree→did not respond it と修正しました。
sen.e: Dr. Fukurai, thinking that the posture of her back to observers might cause suspicion, also persuaded Chizuko again and again, but she did not respond it.

sen.j: そもそも、医院を訪れる患者に対しては正面から向き合っており、能力を発揮するためと言って人に背を向けることからしておかしい。
sen.e: After all she saw visiting patients face-to-face, therefore, it was strange that she put her back to people in order to exert her power.
She saw patients visiting the clinic face-to-face in the first place, therefore, it was strange that she put her back to people in order to exert her power.
sen.cmt: 「医院を訪れる」を補い適宜修正しました。After all→in the first place と修正し、移動しました。
sen.e: She saw patients visiting the clinic face-to-face in the first place, therefore, it was strange that she put her back to people in order to exert her power.

sen.j: さらに、福来博士の最初の実験は、本人を目の前にしたものではない。
sen.e: In addition, the first experiment Dr. FUKURAI was not conducted in his presence.
In addition, the first experiment of Dr. Fukurai was not conducted in front of him.
sen.cmt: of を補いました。FUKURAI→Fukurai,in his presence→in front of him と修正しました。
sen.e: In addition, the first experiment of Dr. Fukurai was not conducted in front of him.

sen.j: 19通の割り印つきの封筒を郵便で送って、中身を透視して返送してもらうものだったが、「透視」されて返却されたのは七通で、残りのうち三通は「うっかり火鉢に落として燃えた」、他は「疲れて出来ない」ということだった。
sen.e: He sent her nineteen envelopes with tally impressions by mail, telling her to see through the contents and send them back to him; however, however, she sent back the seven of them which she tried "toshi", adding that she had carelessly dropped three of them into a hibachi brazier, which were burnt and as to the rest that she was too tired to do the job.

He sent her 19 envelopes with tally impressions by mail, telling her to see through the contents and send them back to him; however, she sent back the 7 of them which she tried 'toshi,' mentioning that the 3 as 'she carelessly dropped them into a hibachi brazier and were burnt,' and as to the rest that 'she was too tired to do the job.'

sen.e: He sent her 19 envelopes with tally impressions by mail, telling her to see through the contents and send them back to him; however, she sent back the 7 of them which she tried 'toshi,' mentioning that the 3 as 'she carelessly dropped them into a hibachi brazier and were burnt,' and as to the rest that 'she was too tired to do the job.'

sen.e: In "Senrigan Series" by Keisuke MATSUOKA, Sachiko YURI (in the film version Hitomi KUROKI acted) appears as a granddaughter of Chizuko MIFUNE, however, it differs from other fictions in that a new interpretation was added that Chizuko's power is neither supernatural phenomena nor deliberate tricks, but that Chizuko, who learned going into a trance by her brother-in-law's hypnotic induction, could easily exert her instinctive powers termed as selective attention in psychology.
